attributes.action: Include a referendum question in the next general election ballot paper.
attributes.additional_details:
The last referendum was invalidated by malpractice. It was also flawed by not making it clear what Brexit meant. A general election will confuse the E.U. question with unrelated party political issues. It will not give a clear, democratic decision on the E.U. 

A general election would afford the opportunity to allow the electorate to provide a clear instruction to Parliament, whatever the outcome of the general election.
attributes.background:
The last E.U. referendum is discredited. 
Democracy demands a new referendum with clear, explicit choices:-

1. Leave the E.U with no deal if a deal cannot be agreed.
2. Leave with the current deal.
3. Withdraw article 50 and remain in the E.U.
